content.raw:
Hmm, being installed side-by-side shouldn't be a problem, but it's plausible that having a dependency that uses `ign-cmake0` could cause some conflicts for a package that uses `ign-cmake1`, because some of the variables that get set by `ign-cmake1` may get altered when the dependency loads `ign-cmake0`.

I suspect the way to deal with that is to make the config-file of `ign-cmake0` a little bit smarter so that it checks if a newer version of `ign-cmake` has already been loaded. When it comes to sorting out build-system dependencies, there should never be a need to use an older version of `ign-cmake`. I'll take a stab at resolving this as soon as I get the chance.
